New Records: Fernando Tatis Jr. was one shy of the NLDS record held by Carlos Beltran and Nick Castellanos
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr.'s towering two-run home run highlighted a six-run second inning
Mookie Betts hit a grand slam with one out in the third off Michael King
Bill Belichick reportedly garnering NFL interest after accepting UNC job
San Diego's second-inning outburst came against losing pitcher Walker Buehler
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres moved within one victory of eliminating the Dodgers in the NLDS for the second time in three seasons
Game 4 is Wednesday night at Petco Park, which was packed with a rally towel-waving record crowd of 47,744
Post-Match Reflections: Robert Suarez struck out Gavin Lux on a full-count pitch to complete a four-out save
Mookie Betts also homered for the Dodgers to break an 0-for-22 playoff slump
San Diego's second-inning outburst came against losing pitcher Walker Buehler
Miscellaneous Highlights: The fans roared as Robert Suarez struck out Gavin Lux on a full-count pitch to complete a four-out save
Bill Belichick reportedly garnering NFL interest after accepting UNC job
San Diego's second-inning outburst came against losing pitcher Walker Buehler
Others: Fernando Tatis Jr.'s shot into the left-field seats was his third of the series
Mookie Betts also homered for the Dodgers to break an 0-for-22 playoff slump
